title: Generative Flow Networks in Covariant Loop Quantum Gravity
authors: Joseph Bunao, Pietropaolo Frisoni, Athanasios Kogios and Jared Wogan
abstract:
Spin foams arose as the covariant (path integral) formulation of quantum
gravity depicting transition amplitudes between different quantum geometry
states. As such, they provide a scheme to study the no boundary proposal,
specifically the nothing to something transition and compute relevant
observables using high performance computing (HPC). Following recent advances,
where stochastic algorithms (Markov Chain Monte Carlo-MCMC) were used, we
employ Generative Flow Networks, a newly developed machine learning algorithm
to compute the expectation value of the dihedral angle for a 4-simplex and
compare the results with previous works.
